intro: Physaria gordonii, commonly known as the Gordon's bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with fleshy, inflated pods that resemble bladders, giving it its common name. Its flowers are small and yellow, typically arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Physaria gordonii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
